etymologies: late Middle English (denoting a knotty swelling or a protuberance): from Latin nodus ‘knot’

definitions: a point at which lines or pathways intersect or branch; a central or connecting point

examples.text: the intersections of two or more such arteries would clearly become major nodes of traffic and urban activity

shortDefinitions: point at which lines intersect or branch

definitions: a piece of equipment, such as a PC or peripheral, attached to a network

examples.text: the company's internal worldwide area network now has some 22,000 nodes

definitions: (in generative grammar) a vertex or endpoint in a tree diagram.
a point at which a curve intersects itself.
shortDefinitions: point at which curve intersects itself

definitions: either of the two points at which a planet's orbit intersects the plane of the ecliptic or the celestial equator.
shortDefinitions: point at which planet's orbit intersects ecliptic

definitions: the part of a plant stem from which one or more leaves emerge, often forming a slight swelling or knob

examples.text: the stem is cut midway between nodes

shortDefinitions: part of stem from which leaf emerges

definitions: a lymph node or other structure consisting of a small mass of differentiated tissue

examples.text: infection in these nodes may lead to backache

definitions: a point at which the amplitude of vibration in a standing wave system is zero.
shortDefinitions: point at which amplitude of vibration is zero

definitions: a point at which a harmonic function has the value zero, especially a point of zero electron density in an orbital.
shortDefinitions: point at which harmonic function is zero

definitions: a point of zero current or voltage.
shortDefinitions: point of zero current or voltage
